intro: Ravnia pittieri, commonly known as the Pittier's ravnia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, temperate climates. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Ravnia pittieri is considered a rare and endangered species.
